basics.name: Ahmad Faraz Khan
basics.label: Ph.D. Candidate in Computer Science
basics.summary: Ph.D. candidate specializing in Machine Learning Systems, with a robust focus on Federated Learning optimization. Demonstrates comprehensive expertise across programming languages and development tools, contributing significantly to both academic research and practical applications.

work.name: Virginia Tech, DSSL
work.summary: Engaged in cutting-edge research focused on optimizing Federated Learning through novel frameworks and methodologies. Responsible for spearheading multiple projects aimed at enhancing model performance and efficiency in distributed learning environments.
highlights: Introduced 'FLOAT' framework for optimizing Federated Learning's resource utilization
Developed an adaptive FL aggregator for Edge and IoT devices
Designed a heterogeneity-aware adaptive FL scheduling system

work.name: i2c Inc.
work.summary: Spearheaded the development and maintenance of distributed databases, focusing on performance optimization and scalability.

publications.name: Optimizing Federated Learning's Resource Utilization with 'FLOAT'
publications.summary: Introduced a novel framework leveraging Reinforcement Learning for optimizing Federated Learning in heterogeneous environments.

publications.name: Monetizing Personalized Federated Learning with System and Data Heterogeneity
publications.summary: Explored innovative approaches to monetizing personalized Federated Learning, addressing system and data heterogeneity.

publications.name: Adaptive Federated Learning Aggregator for Edge and IoT
publications.summary: Developed an adaptive aggregator that significantly enhances scalability and time efficiency for Federated Learning on Edge and IoT devices.

publications.name: Defending Against Inference Attacks in Vertical Federated Learning
publications.summary: Proposed a lossless and efficient defense mechanism for inference attacks in Vertical Federated Learning environments.

publications.name: Analyzing Personalized Federated Learning Algorithms
publications.summary: Conducted a thorough analysis of personalized FL algorithms, highlighting the trade-offs between privacy and performance.

projects.name: Federated Learning Frameworks
projects.summary: Led the design and development of both Horizontal and Vertical Federated Learning frameworks, integrating MLOps pipelines with AWS cloud resources.
highlights: Significant contributions to AAAI'24 and AAMAS'24

projects.name: ML System Optimization
projects.summary: Developed algorithms to enhance ML system architectures for improved resource allocation, scalability, and efficiency.
highlights: Impactful contributions leading to publications in IEEE and ACM conferences
